intro: Begonia subcoriacea, commonly known as the rough begonia, is a species native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its thick, leathery leaves that have a distinctive textured surface. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically bright red or orange in color. It thrives in warm, humid environments and prefers well-drained soil. Begonia subcoriacea is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
